title: Universal Praise
shortSummary: Psalm 148 is a majestic call for all creation—heavenly beings, celestial bodies, natural elements, animals, and humanity—to praise the LORD. This chapter emphasizes God's sovereign power as Creator and Sustainer, highlighting the universal scope of worship due to Him. It culminates in the exaltation of His people, Israel, as a testimony to His intimate relationship with His chosen.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - United Monarchy Period, attributed to King David

keyCharacters.name: Angels
keyCharacters.description: Heavenly beings who serve God and are called to praise Him in the heavenly realms.

keyCharacters.name: Children of Israel
keyCharacters.description: God's chosen people, exalted in the psalm as those near to Him and recipients of His special favor.

keyCharacters.name: Kings and Princes of the Earth
keyCharacters.description: Earthly rulers and judges who are included in the call to worship God, representing all human authority.

definitions.definition: In biblical context, often refers to sea monsters or large, powerful creatures symbolizing the depths and chaos.
A phrase denoting the highest heavens, beyond the visible sky, emphasizing God's supreme domain.
A symbol of strength and power, often used to represent honor and exaltation in biblical literature.
Refers to armies or multitudes, often used for angelic beings or heavenly armies serving God.

outline.heading: Call to Praise from the Heavenly Realm
outline.description: The psalm opens with a summons for praise from the heavens, including angels and celestial bodies, affirming that all were created by God's command and established eternally.

outline.heading: Call to Praise from the Earthly Realm
outline.description: The focus shifts to the earth, calling on natural elements, animals, and all people—from rulers to children—to join in worship, demonstrating the comprehensive nature of God's creation.

outline.heading: Reason for Praise and Exaltation of God's People
outline.description: The psalm concludes by emphasizing God's excellent name and glory, and His special exaltation of Israel, His people, highlighting their unique relationship with Him.

application: Recognize and worship God as Creator and Sustainer of all things, offering praise in all circumstances and settings.
Include all aspects of life—nature, authorities, and community—in your prayers of praise, acknowledging God's sovereign rule.
Trust in God's eternal decrees and faithfulness, knowing His creation and promises stand forever.
Celebrate and support the people of God, remembering their special place in God's redemptive plan.

keyVerses.text: Let them praise the name of the LORD: for he commanded, and they were created.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights God's sovereign authority as Creator, the foundation for all praise.

keyVerses.text: Let them praise the name of the LORD: for his name alone is excellent; his glory is above the earth and heaven.
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes the unmatched excellence and glory of God's name, worthy of universal worship.

keyVerses.text: He also exalteth the horn of his people, the praise of all his saints; even of the children of Israel, a people near unto him. Praise ye the LORD.
keyVerses.significance: This verse affirms God's special favor toward Israel and the exaltation of His faithful people.
